intro: Onychium gracile, commonly known as the slender onychium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
